title: GraphPad Prism (com.graphpad.prism)
description: Preference settings for GraphPad Prism. Jamf Pro supports many but not all elements and options here: https://github.com/json-editor/json-editor.

login-url.title: Login URL
login-url.description: URL for the login server when using local LabArchives installation (rare).

api-url.title: API URL
api-url.description: URL for LabArchives server when using local LabArchives installation (rare).

browse-url.title: Browse URL
browse-url.description: This URL is opened on clicking Browse menu item in LA toolbar menu.

error-connection.title: Error connection alert text
error-connection.description: Alert text when no connection to labarchives server is established. Overrides the usual message. Useful if you want to include an IT contact in the message.

try-account-blurb.title: Try account blurb
try-account-blurb.description: Short text, displayed in Try account of Login to labarchives dialog. Useful if you don't want people using a demo account, because they have access to an institutional account.

measure-units.title: Measure units
measure-units.description: Measure units to use in Prism. Could be imperial or metric. Default settings is imperial (inches).

module-file.title: Module File
module-file.description: (Folder) is the folder name inside the Prism/Module folder to custom resource DLL file to load (e.g. Japanese translation or custom equations library).

preferences-read-only.title: Preferences Read Only
preferences-read-only.description: Do not overwrite preferences on exiting Prism. This lets everyone start with a standard set of preferences. This might be sueful, for example, in a teaching lab.

serial-number.title: Serial number
serial-number.description: Default serial number. If Prism is not activated, this serial number will be prefilled in the Activation dialog, step Enter Serial Number.

silent-activation.title: Silent Activation
silent-activation.description: If set to true, Prism will attempt to activate the license silently, without requiring that the user do anything. The default is to not activate silently

request-timeout.title: Disk Cache Size
request-timeout.description: The timeout parameter applies to all Internet requests where Prism has to wait for a response, which includes manual activation, silent activation, phone home, web updates and LabArchives.
